title: Why are nitrites toxic to tank fish, but nitrates are okay? - Quora

response.answer_text: That one oxygen atom changes the shape, structure, and function. For example Nitrates are used in many fertilizers and explosives. Nitrites are used in food preservation. Nitrates form strong acids and nitrates form weaker acids. That one extra oxygen atom in Nitrates makes a huge difference. Also worth mentioning whenever "it's just one atom!" comes up: water and hydrogen peroxide are just one oxygen atom apart - H2O vs. H2O2. Water is...well, water. Hydrogen peroxide is violently explosive under the right circumstances and was used as a component of rocket fuel. Sodium is violently explosive; chlorine is horribly toxic. Sodium chloride is table salt.
